These appeared around the same time that I added a new Installed JRE and changed the default to the new one.

'null' isn't a valid return value according to the spec of IPackageFragmentRoot.getRawClasspathEntry().
A JME would be ok to be thrown when the classpath entry deosn't exist anymore.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 162104 ***
